2004 Volvo S40

For the next-generation S40, Volvo took the core elements of the full-size S80-comfort, technology and safety-and tried to squeeze them into the smaller package. "Premium small-car buyers don't compromise much,'' says Volvo president and CEO Hans-Olov Olsson. The new car is actually shorter in length than its predecessor, but wider and taller, creating more interior room. Adding to the sense of interior space is Volvo's first use of its slim free-floating center control stack, with simple controls that integrate the same pattern as a television remote. S40 goes on sale in March, followed by a V40 wagon version late next year.
AutoWeek
September 22, 2003
